title: Division
text: Remember that $$\frac{f}{g}$$ is the same as $$\frac{f}{g} x$$. All we have to do is divide the two functions.

title: Division
text: Let's write the quotient of these functions as a fraction: (3x**2)/(sqrt(x-5). Because the bottom of the function is a square root, we need to rationalize the function by getting rid of the square root in the denominator.

title: Rationalization
text: To do this, we need to square $$\sqrt{x-5}$$ so that the denominator doesn't have a square root. So, we have to multiply (3x**2)/(sqrt(x-5) by $$\frac{\sqrt{x-5}}{\sqrt{x-5}}$$.

title: Multiplication
text: Since there is no way to simplify the product of $$3x^2 \sqrt{x-5}$$, this leaves us with ((3x**2)(sqrt(x-5))/(x-5)
